inputs.note: Using FY2024 actual data. FCF approximated by Operating Cash Flow given minimal maintenance capex requirements post-automation investments.

historical_growth.revenue_calculation_note: FY2020-FY2024 excluding anomalous FY2023 cyclone year: 251.5 to 411.4 over 4 years effective = 13.1% CAGR. FY2021-FY2024 (excl FY2023): 309.6 to 411.4 over 3 years effective = 17.8%
historical_growth.eps_calculation_note: FY2020-FY2024 excluding FY2023: 0.52 to 0.21. Negative due to deferred tax charge in FY2024. Adjusted EPS of 0.51 would show -0.5% CAGR. EPS highly volatile and not reliable for growth projection.
historical_growth.equity_calculation_note: FY2020-FY2024 excluding FY2023: 176.3 to 266.4 over 4 years effective = 8.6% CAGR. FY2021-FY2024 (excl FY2023): 246.5 to 266.4 over 3 years effective = 5.6%
historical_growth.fcf_calculation_note: Using Operating Cash Flow as FCF proxy. FY2020-FY2024 excluding FY2023: 26.4 to 66.0 over 4 years effective = 20.2% CAGR. FY2021-FY2024 (excl FY2023): 41.6 to 66.0 over 3 years effective = 16.5%
historical_growth.growth_rate_rationale: Conservative value investing approach uses equity CAGR as primary metric. Equity growth of 8.6% more sustainable than revenue (13.1%) or FCF (20.2%) given cyclicality. FCF artificially elevated by FY2024 recovery from cyclone year. Revenue growth partly driven by volume recovery rather than structural expansion.
historical_growth.growth_divergence_warning: Revenue CAGR (13.1%) and FCF CAGR (20.2%) significantly exceed Equity CAGR (8.6%), driven by cyclical recovery from FY2023 cyclone impact. Equity growth more conservative and appropriate given business volatility.

base.growth_rationale: Start above equity CAGR (8.6%) reflecting strong industry tailwinds and H1-2025 momentum, then decelerate toward mature industry growth. Year 1: 12% reflects Zespri record season forecast. Years 2-5: gradual deceleration as industry matures.
base.fcf_margin_rationale: FY2024 FCF/Revenue = 66.0/411.4 = 16.0%. Maintain this level assuming stable operations and minimal growth capex given existing 50m+ tray capacity.
base.wacc_rationale: Higher than typical 9-10% WACC given: cyclical volume volatility, weather/climate exposure, customer concentration (Zespri), NZ small-cap liquidity premium, and current net debt of 51% of equity.
base.terminal_growth_rationale: Mature NZ kiwifruit industry with modest long-term expansion. Below NZ GDP growth (2.5-3%) given market saturation and cyclical nature.

bull.growth_rationale: Aggressive volume growth from Zespri 205-215m tray season, market share gains, Australian expansion accelerating, and automation driving margin improvement. Assumes strong execution and favorable weather.
bull.fcf_margin_rationale: Margin expansion from automation efficiencies (cost per tray down 19% in FY2024), operating leverage on higher volumes, and improved Australian profitability.
bull.wacc_rationale: Lower risk premium as balance sheet improves with debt reduction, dividend re-established, and operational track record strengthens.
bull.terminal_growth_rationale: Industry continues moderate expansion beyond current forecasts, Seeka gains market share through consolidation, Australian operations become material contributor.

bear.growth_rationale: Weather impacts return (cyclone, water stress), volume volatility, automation investments underperform, Australian expansion disappoints, or competitive pressure from MPac/EastPack.
bear.fcf_margin_rationale: Margin compression from lower volumes hitting fixed cost base (FY2023 demonstrated downside), increased competition, wage inflation, or automation execution issues.
bear.wacc_rationale: Higher risk premium reflecting volume volatility, climate/weather exposure, debt burden limiting flexibility, and execution risk on automation/Australian expansion.
bear.terminal_growth_rationale: Structural headwinds from climate change, mature industry, limited growth beyond current trajectory, or regulatory changes to Zespri model.

base.margin_of_safety: Base case shows stock trading at 78% discount to intrinsic value

bull.margin_of_safety: Bull case shows stock trading at 87% discount to intrinsic value

bear.margin_of_safety: Bear case shows stock trading at 52% discount to intrinsic value

base.interpretation: To achieve 15% annual returns from current price to terminal value, investor could enter at $13.91 (current price $4.65 offers 199% upside to this entry point)

bull.interpretation: Bull case terminal value supports entry price of $23.52 for 15% CAGR

bear.interpretation: Even in bear case, current price of $4.65 offers significant margin of safety to $7.12 entry price

base_case_matrix.note: Matrix shows intrinsic value per share across different WACC and terminal growth assumptions using base case FCF projections. Current price $4.65 is below ALL scenarios.

probability_weighted_valuation.interpretation: Probability-weighted intrinsic value of $21.91 suggests stock is trading at 78% discount even after weighting bear case at 25%

key_metrics_summary.fcf_yield_note: Based on FY2024 FCF of $66.0m / market cap of $193.4m = 34.1% - exceptionally high

strengths: Conservative equity CAGR (8.6%) used as growth foundation despite higher revenue/FCF growth rates
WACC of 11% appropriately reflects cyclical volatility and weather dependency
FCF margins based on actual FY2024 performance (16%) rather than optimistic projections
Excludes anomalous FY2023 cyclone year from growth calculations
Higher discount rate (11% vs typical 9-10%) accounts for small-cap, weather, and customer concentration risks
Sensitivity analysis shows intrinsic value exceeds current price across ALL reasonable scenarios
limitations: OCF used as FCF proxy - may overstate true free cash flow if capex requirements increase
High cyclicality makes steady-state growth assumptions difficult - actual results will be volatile
Zespri customer concentration (60% of revenue) creates binary risk not fully captured in scenarios
Climate change and weather volatility increasing - historical patterns may not predict future
Terminal value comprises 69% of base case equity value - sensitive to terminal assumptions
Small sample size for growth calculations due to excluding FY2023 anomaly year
dcf_quality_assessment.confidence_level: Moderate - Model indicates significant undervaluation, but business volatility and external dependencies create execution uncertainty. All three scenarios suggest current price offers margin of safety.

investment_recommendation.rationale: Seeka trades at $4.65 vs probability-weighted intrinsic value of $21.91 (78% discount). Even conservative bear case of $9.78 implies 110% upside. Exceptional FCF yield of 34%, dividend restart at 4.3% yield, and strong H1-2025 momentum validate recovery thesis. Current price offers significant margin of safety across all scenarios.
catalysts: Zespri record 2025/26 season of 205-215m trays driving volume growth
Continued debt reduction from strong cash generation improving balance sheet
New Kerikeri automated facility commissioning in 2025
Australian expansion contributing meaningful earnings as new orchards mature
Potential industry consolidation with Seeka acquiring smaller competitors
Interest rate declines reducing $17.1m annual finance expense
risks_to_thesis: Weather event or cyclone impacting volumes (primary risk)
Zespri season forecast disappoints or grower returns decline
Competitive pressure from MPac or EastPack
Australian expansion execution issues or Psa disease outbreak
Debt covenant breach if volumes collapse similar to FY2023
investment_recommendation.position_sizing: Moderate position (5-10% of portfolio) given high upside but cyclical volatility. Consider building position over time to average through seasonal volatility. Stop loss at 20% below entry given wide intrinsic value range.

price_targets.current_entry_assessment: Current price of $4.65 is BELOW even bear case entry price of $7.12 - exceptional risk/reward

sanity_checks: Current price $4.65 vs book value per share $6.40 = 0.73x P/B (reasonable for cyclical business)
Implied EV/EBITDA: (193.4 + 136.9) / 76.1 = 4.3x (very low for growing business)
FCF yield of 34% suggests either severe undervaluation or unsustainable FCF
Terminal value per share of $27.99 vs current price $4.65 = 6x multiple seems high but supported by recovery trajectory
Base case assumes 8.6% equity CAGR vs historical 8.6% - consistent and conservative
model_validation.peer_comparison_note: Limited direct peers - EastPack and MPac are private. Zespri is cooperative. International post-harvest operators trade at higher multiples but lack comparable cyclical exposure.
model_validation.analyst_consensus_note: Consensus target of $2.50 appears severely outdated given FY2024 results. Alpha Spread IV of $9.27 closer to bear case. Model suggests market significantly undervalues recovery potential.

methodology_notes.fcf_calculation: Operating Cash Flow used as FCF proxy given minimal maintenance capex post-automation. Management indicated growth capex held to maintenance levels. FY2024 OCF of $66.0m represents sustainable run-rate.
methodology_notes.growth_rate_selection: Equity CAGR (8.6%) selected over revenue CAGR (13.1%) or FCF CAGR (20.2%) for conservative value approach. Higher cyclical volatility requires conservative baseline.
methodology_notes.wacc_components: Risk-free rate 4.5% (NZ 10-year bond) + equity risk premium 7% + small-cap premium 2% + cyclical premium 1.5% - leverage benefit 4% = 11% WACC
methodology_notes.terminal_value: Perpetuity growth model: FCF_year5 * (1 + g) / (WACC - g). Terminal growth of 2.5% conservative given mature industry.
methodology_notes.scenario_probabilities: Base case 50% reflects balanced view. Bull/Bear 25% each given high uncertainty from weather/volume volatility.
